DOC.detailed_description: Study Aims : 1 . To test hypothesis premenopausal HypoE associate pre-clinical CVD determine reduction vascular endothelial function increase central arterial stiffness . 2 . To test hypothesis premenopausal HypoE associate increase immune-mediated inflammation . 3 . To test hypothesis estrogen reduce inflammation , improve vascular endothelial function central arterial stiffness premenopausal HypoE woman . In randomized , double-blind placebo-controlled trial premenopausal HypoE woman investigator test 12 week transdermal estradiol 0.1 mg/day patch placebo follow 2 week estradiol plus progesterone 200mg vascular endothelial function , arterial stiffness immune-mediated inflammation versus placebo . Patches apply participant low abdomen twice weekly , alternate side . The investigator use non-invasive test measure vascular function include : - Peripheral arterial tonometry ( PAT ) - SphygmoCor measurement central blood pressure - Carotid intima-media thickness ( CIMT )
